Dear Sheffield City Council,
With Duty of Care being of paramount importance right now, could you please confirm what technology the Council uses to contact employees in the case of emergency situations?  Does this technology have geo-fencing capabilities?
Also, who is responsible for Employee Duty of Care, Business Continuity and your Employee comms strategy?
Yours faithfully,
R Barnes

Dear R Barnes,
Thank you for your request for information relating to duty of care which
we received on 18/10/2024.
This has been logged as a Freedom of Information Request and will be dealt
with under the Freedom of Information Act 2000. The reference number for
your request can be found above.
The Freedom of Information Act 2000 states that we must respond to you
within 20 working days, by 15/11/2024. Please do not hesitate to contact
us at the email address below if you have any queries.
Yours sincerely,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ

Dear R Barnes,
Thank you for your request for information relating to duty of care which
we received on 18/10/2024.
Please find Sheffield City Council’s response to your request set out
below:
• With Duty of Care being of paramount importance right now, could you
please confirm what technology the Council uses to contact employees
in the case of emergency situations?
Each service and manager will cascade information down to their direct
reports in case of emergency, by phone, email , whats app etc.  We also
utilise Gov Delivery for blanket wide communications where appropriate.
• Does this technology have geo-fencing capabilities?
No, not that we are aware of, and if it does, we do not use it.
• Also, who is responsible for
◦ Employee Duty of Care
Each individual manager that has managerial responsibility
◦ Business Continuity and
Each individual Service is responsible for their own BC
◦ your Employee comms strategy?
The communications team is responsible for employee comms.
If you have any queries about this response, please do not hesitate to
contact us.
The information provided in this response is available for re-use under
the terms of the Open Government Licence v3.0. The terms of the OGL can be
found [1]here. When re-using the information, Sheffield City Council
requires you to include the following attribution statement: “Contains
public sector information obtained from Sheffield City Council and
licensed under the Open Government Licence v3.0.”
If you are unhappy with the response you have received in relation to your
request, you are entitled to have this reviewed. You can ask for an
internal review by replying to this email. Internal review requests should
be submitted within 40 working days from the date of this response.
If you remain dissatisfied with the outcome of your internal review, you
can contact the Information Commissioner’s Office. Please see
[2]
https://ico.org.uk/make-a-complaint/offi...
for further details.
Kind Regards,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ
